## [ğŸ“Š]{aria-hidden="true"} The Data of Data

I find something poetic in tracing this lineage with modern tools. Using the **World Bankâ€™s historical population dataset**, we can visualize how humanityâ€™s capacity to count itself expanded almost in lockstep with its population.

```{r}
#| label: load-owid-world-pop
#| include: false

# Resilient loader for OWID world population, with cache + fallbacks

library(tidyverse)

get_owid_world_pop <- function(local_path = "data/owid_population_world.csv") {
dir.create("data", showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)

# Use cached file if it exists

if (file.exists(local_path)) {
owid <- readr::read_csv(local_path, show_col_types = FALSE)
return(owid)
}

# Candidate URLs

urls <- c(
"[https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/population.csv](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/population.csv)",
"[https://raw.githubusercontent.com/owid/owid-data/master/processed/owid-population.csv](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/owid/owid-data/master/processed/owid-population.csv)"
)

for (u in urls) {
tf <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")
ok <- try(suppressWarnings(utils::download.file(u, tf, mode = "wb", quiet = TRUE)), silent = TRUE)
if (!inherits(ok, "try-error")) {
owid <- try(readr::read_csv(tf, show_col_types = FALSE), silent = TRUE)
if (!inherits(owid, "try-error")) {
readr::write_csv(owid, local_path)
return(owid)
}
}
}

# Fallback minimal dataset

tibble(
entity = "World",
year = c(1800, 1850, 1900, 1950, 1970, 1990, 2000, 2010, 2020),
population = c(1e9, 1.26e9, 1.65e9, 2.52e9, 3.7e9, 5.3e9, 6.1e9, 6.9e9, 7.8e9)
)
}
```

::: {.callout-tip icon="globe"}
```{r}
#| label: fig-world-population-long
#| fig-cap: "World population since 1800, with modern WDI overlay"
#| message: false
library(tidyverse)
library(WDI)
library(janitor)

owid <- get_owid_world_pop()

# --- WDI (1960+) ---
wdi_raw <- try(
  WDI(indicator = "SP.POP.TOTL",
      start = 1960,
      end   = as.integer(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y"))),
  silent = TRUE
)

if (inherits(wdi_raw, "try-error")) {
  wdi_world <- tibble(year = integer(), pop = numeric())
} else {
  # Filter to the global aggregate
  wdi_world <- wdi_raw %>%
    filter(iso2c == "1W" | country == "World") %>%
    select(year, pop = SP.POP.TOTL)
}


# --- OWID historical (ensure correct columns + units) ---

tmp <- owid %>%
clean_names() %>%
rename(pop = population)

if ("entity" %in% names(tmp) && any(tolower(tmp$entity) == "world")) {
owid_world <- tmp %>%
filter(tolower(entity) == "world", !is.na(year), !is.na(pop)) %>%
distinct(year, .keep_all = TRUE)
} else {

# Fallback: aggregate across all entities per year

owid_world <- tmp %>%
group_by(year) %>%
summarise(pop = sum(pop, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")
}

# Normalize OWID units if provided in millions

if (max(owid_world$pop, na.rm = TRUE) < 1e6) {
owid_world <- owid_world %>% mutate(pop = pop * 1e6)
}

ggplot() +
geom_area(data = owid_world, aes(year, pop / 1e9), alpha = 0.2) +
geom_line(data = wdi_world,  aes(year, pop / 1e9)) +
geom_vline(xintercept = 1960, linetype = "dotted") +
annotate(
"text",
x = 1961,
y = max(c(owid_world$pop, wdi_world$pop), na.rm = TRUE) / 1e9 * 0.9,
label = "Official WDI begins (1960)",
hjust = 0, size = 3
) +
labs(
title = "World Population: 1800â€“present",
subtitle = "Historical (shaded, OWID/Maddison) with modern WDI overlay (solid line)",
x = NULL, y = "Billions"
)
```
:::

> **Methods Note.** Historical population is sourced from OWID/Maddison where available; modern population (1960â€“present) uses World Bank WDI `SP.POP.TOTL`. If the build environment lacks internet, a small offline fallback ensures the chart still renders.
